official-title.#text:
To amend the Wild and Scenic Rivers Act to designate
		  segments of the mainstem of the Nashua River and its tributaries in the
		  Commonwealth of Massachusetts for study for potential addition to the National
		  Wild and Scenic Rivers System, and for other purposes.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text:
Nashua River Wild and Scenic River
			 Study Act

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end the
			 following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 5(a) of the Wild
			 and Scenic Rivers Act

text.#text:
The approximately 19-mile segment of the
				mainstem of the Nashua River from the confluence of the North and South Nashua
				Rivers in Lancaster, Massachusetts, north to the Massachusetts/New Hampshire
				State line, and its tributaries, except the approximately 4.8-mile segment of
				the mainstem of the Nashua River from the Route 119 bridge in Groton,
				Massachusetts, downstream to its confluence with the Nissitissit River in
				Pepperell, Massachusetts.

The 10-mile segment of the Squannacook
				River from its headwaters at Ash Swamp downstream to its confluence with the
				Nashua River in Shirley/Ayer, Massachusetts.

The 3.5-mile segment of the
				Nissitissit River from the Massachusetts/New Hampshire State line downstream to
				its confluence with the Nashua River in Pepperell,
				Massachusetts.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
is amended by adding at the end
			 the following:

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Section 5(b) of the
			 Wild and Scenic Rivers Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall complete the study of the Nashua River in
				Massachusetts and New Hampshire, as described in

, and
				submit a report describing the results of that study to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Committee on
				Natural Resources of the House of Representatives

Committee on Energy
				and Natural Resources of the
				Senate

text.#text:

				after the date on which funds are made available to carry out this paragraph,
				the

Nashua River Wild and Scenic River Study Act
